@anujbhan I'm not the marcus you're looking for :)

@machristie  and @scnakandala ,
I have implemented the discussed features, and also added resetPass and find user API's as requested by Supun.

Changes made in the new commit - 

Added new method checkDuplicateGateway() in TenantProfileServiceHandler.java to identify duplicate requests for Gateway Ids that have already been approved

Modified FIND_GATEWAY_BY_ID in QueryConstants.java to return only Approved Gateways

Added new method getAllGatewaysForUser() in TenantProfileServiceHandler.java as a Thrift service to display gateways belonging to a particular user
Added new method getAllGatewaysForUser() in TenantProfileRepository.java to retrieve the GET_USER_GATEWAYS query result
Modified profile_tenant_cpi.thrift to include getAllGatewaysForUser() and generated the stubs to reflect in Iface (TenantProfileService.java)
Added GET_USER_GATEWAYS in QueryContsants.java to return all Gateways belonging to a particular user

Modified workspace_model.thrift to expose the Gateway's airavataInternalId to Update and Delete Gateways and generated the stubs to reflect in Gateway.java
Modified deleteGateway() in profile_tenant_cpi.thrift to accept the airavataInternalId as a parameter and generated the stubs to reflect in Iface (TenantProfileService.java)
Thanks Madrina for this contribution. I will review and merge it so others can use the same module structure.

Hi Nikita, 

Please update the .gitignore file to ignore your IDE specific modules from being committed. Those files are not necessary for the project.

Thanks.
@DImuthuUpe can you please submit this PR to airavata sandbox repo - https://github.com/apache/airavata-sandbox
@smarru https://github.com/apache/airavata-sandbox/pull/8
Seems like Eroma has already committed this gateway.
@harsha161992 please send this PR to airavata sandbox repo - https://github.com/apache/airavata-sandbox/tree/master/allocation-manager
@scnakandala can you please review this PR?

@sachinkariyattin My understanding is that admins are for each domain. But not for each group. But from the implementation code I see that admin table will have a reference to a group. I think this should not be the case. Do you have a specific reason why you modelled the admin table like this?

@scnakandala I am suggesting we have admins for each group. An example use case is airavata for class room. A domain level admin will create a group for class to be taught and will make a faculty who is teaching that class an admin. The faculty can further add AI/TA's as admins to the group. Only these admins can add other users to this group and so on.
Makes sense @smarru. The pull request seems ok to me. I suggest that we change the names a little bit so that it won't create confusion. For eg. Admin -> GroupAdmin, Owner -> GroupOwner etc.
@sachinkariyattin can you please change the names as supun suggested as propagate them all the way to the DB.  i can then merge this PR.

@smarru @scnakandala Thanks for the review. 
I will make the suggested changes and update the PR
@smarru I have made the changes

@shubhamkr1 you seems to have created this PR from master. Please create a new PR from develop branch and use git rebase to make sure only your commits show. As you can see above there are 87 commits you submitted in this PR, lot of them from merges and this will be hard to review.
this looks good to me. @machristie any further suggestions?
@harsha161992 i think we can close this PR right? since you now have it in sandbox repo?
since there are no significant changes in this PR, i a, closing it
closing this one since the new PR's were submitted to sandbox repo
closing this PR as new pr's have been submitted to sandbox repo

closing this one since the new pr's were submitted to sandbox repo

@smarru  I was creating the Sharing Service client using the org.apache.airavata.api.server.util.ThriftClientPool. Should I just create a regular client instead of using the object pool?

Files changed:
- AiravataServerHandler.java -> Modified launchExperiment() to first check if the current user has access to the Application Module

@sachinkariyattin the client pool is recommended. For now create a regular client, but after this PR is completed, lets move the client pool to a commons library and use it in all thrift servers. There are quite a few thrift servers which are not using this.
@machristie any impressions on this PR?
@smarru I have made the final changes. I have updated the wiki with instructions to test this. Please review.
@smarru I have made the final changes. I have updated the wiki with instructions to test this. Please review.
@smarru Looks good to me
The rebase is not working well since the branch is too out-dated, I will force update the branch.
@sachinkariyattin are there any DB changes compared to gateway resource profile in develop branch?
@smarru No. I have used the same DB script (appcatalog-derby.sql) that currently exists in develop branch.
Thanks @syodage ! Any idea why these changes are needed, why the build started failing now?
Looks good, @DImuthuUpe . I'm going to pull these commits into a branch off master and merge them into develop and master.
I merged this manually.
Looks good, thanks @sachinkariyattin

My only feedback is that I think we should be following the pattern in AiravataServerHandler where it checks a SharingRegistry service client out of a pool of clients and then checks it back in at the end of the method.  This way these connections get cleaned up.  But that is maybe worthy of being a separate issue.

I created issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AIRAVATA-2650.
Good point, thanks @sachinkariyattin . I'll link the two issues.

Made necessary changes to thrift models -
- airavata_api.thrift
- registry-api.thrift

Regenerated the services from thrift models - 
- RegistryService.java
- Airavata.java

Added new methods - 
- getAccessibleAppModules()
- getAccessibleApplicationDeployments()

Reverted the old methods - 
- getAllAppModules()
- getAllApplicationDeployments()

Made changes to the interfaces -
- ApplicationDeployment.java
- ApplicationInterface.java
@machristie Thanks for the review. Implemented the suggested changes.
@eldhomathulla here's Sachin's pull request. See especially his changes to Thrift files.

@machristie Thanks for the review. 
I have implemented the suggested changes.

Sneha, this looks good. I think one additional thing we'll need to do is to share every application deployment with the "everyone" group. Can you add that to this script as well? So what we'll do is run the everyone migration that you created in the other pull request and then we can run this migration script.

@tilaks26 , can you also change the sharing registry so that whenever a new user is created it is added to the everyone group?  The migration script will add all existing users to the everyone group but we need to also add any new users that get created after the migration script runs to the everyone group.
Nice job Sachin!
@machristie , I've made the requested changes.
@machristie , do you want me to use the Sharing Client like in the everyone migrator or follow the Sharing Handler convention in the data migrator?
@tilaks26 yeah I think it should use the sharing client too.
Looks good @DImuthuUpe . I'm going to merge this into the develop branch and run a deploy just to test it out first before merging to the master branch.
@machristie I've made the requested changes.

@sachinkariyattin This looks great! Thanks for quickly putting this together. 

It does look like a couple of sharing tests failed:
* org.apache.airavata.sharing.registry.SharingRegistryServiceTest
* org.apache.airavata.sharing.registry.SharingRegistryServerHandlerTest

They both fail with this error
```
org.apache.airavata.sharing.registry.models.SharingRegistryException: New group owner is not part of the group Stack trace:SharingRegistryException(message:New group owner is not part of the group)
```

I wonder if maybe transferGroupOwnership should just add the new owner to the group if the new owner isn't already a member of the group?

----
On second though, requiring that the new owner be a group member makes sense too. In which case just the tests need to be updated.
@DImuthuUpe looks good! Can you make the changes on your develop branch instead, so we can merge this into develop?

@machristie, this is specific to group-based-auth branch. In develop branch there is no RuntimeException thrown unless you haven't merged group-based-auth to develop. I only have to improve the logs. Shall I do that change or do you expect to merge group-based-auth to develop in future?

@DImuthuUpe the RuntimeException change is on the develop branch: https://github.com/apache/airavata/commit/f5aaf3305418c72856f6927556ae78be6398963d. The develop branch was then merged into the group-based-auth branch at a later point in time which is why the RuntimeException change is also on the group-based-auth branch.

The plan is to periodically merge develop into group-based-auth and then eventually, once the group based auth work is done, merge group-based-auth back into develop.  So for now let's fix this on develop branch.
@machristie Thanks for the review. I forgot to update the tests. Fixed it now.
Thanks @sachinkariyattin . I think we'll also need this for all of the boolean fields in the entities.
@machristie I will consider this and make changes to all the entities in my next PR for registry refactoring
Closing as this was applied on develop branch

Changes to the AiravataDataMigrator.java class:
- Removed the EveryoneGroupMigrator.java class and included the changes in AiravataDataMigrator.java class
- Modified the pom.xml to include the security services stubs as well
- Retrieving groupOwner and ApplicationDeploymentOwner from the KeyCloakSecurityManager.java class
- Added a new PermissionType - EXEC for Application Deployments

Changes to the AiravataServerHandler.java class:
- Added a new PermissionType - EXEC for methods - initSharingRegistry(), addGateway(), shareResourceWithUsers() and revokeSharingOfResourceFromUsers()
- Modified getAccessibleApplicationDeployments() to first retrieve all the Group Resource Profiles accessible by the user in the gateway and extracting all the Compute Resource IDs from the list of Group Resource Profiles which is then passed to the getAccessibleApplicationDeployments() of the RegsitryServerHandler.java class

Changes to the registry-api.thrift, RegistryServerHandler.java class and ApplicationDeployment.java interface:
- Modified getAccessibleApplicationDeployments() to accept the accessible Compute Resource IDs
- Regenerated the Thrift files for Registry

Changes to the AppDeploymentResource.java class:
- Modified getAll() to also filter by the accessible Compute Resource IDs
This Pull Request contains the fixes and suggestions for [AIRAVATA-2690] ticket as well.

Also, can you update getAccessibleAppModules in the AiravataServerHandler, similar to what you did with getAccessibleApplicationDeployments?
@machristie Thanks for the review. I have implemented the changes. Please have a look.
@machristie Thank you for the review. I have modified the getAccessible methods as requested and updated the PR.

This won't work when deploying multiple PGAs in the same Apache server, they will each overwrite the other.  This default configuration was added to prevent Apache from displaying some random virtual host when the IP address or some non-virtual host domain name is visited.
Why didn't the virtual host configuration work in pga-default.conf?
The format of `<VirtualHost *:8008>` in `pga-default.conf` didn't work for me. I had to manually change it to `<VirtualHost 192.168.1.10:8008>` (192.168.1.10 - my IP address) in order to get it work
So going to http://192.168.1.10:8008 didn't load the PGA?  You got the default Apache page?  Can you dig into this a little more and find out why going to http://192.168.1.10:8008 didn't work?
Looks really good Sachin! Thanks!
yes @machristie it didn't work, I always got the Apache Testing page. Sure I will try to find it.

Hi @machristie, 
The problem was server doesn't pick the VirtualHost as the best match for the particular IP address and port. This [answer](The problem was server doesn't pick the VirtualHost as the best match for the particular IP address and port. ) confirms it. 
There were some solutions in order to get the work done

1. Change `<VirtualHost *:8008>` into `<VirtualHost 192.168.1.10:8008>` in **pga-default.conf**
2. Add a ServerName to default VirtualHost in **default.conf**

But the problem was, with the configuration `<VirtualHost *:8008>` some of my colleagues have received successful results. This problem occurred only for me. This [link](https://serverfault.com/questions/901342/virtualhost-is-not-taken-as-the-best-match?noredirect=1#comment1165724_901342) is the answer for that (I question that I asked in **serverfault**
@DImuthuUpe I have updated the suggested changes.
